content.prompt: For which of the following containers would the graph be appropriate?

choices.label:
• This is a right circular cylinder with circles at the top and bottom that are the same size.
  • The diameter of the cylinder is constant from the top of the cylinder to the bottom of the cylinder.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.
  • Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container narrows until reaching the midpoint vertically and then widens again until reaching the top.
  • The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.
  • Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container increases until reaching the midpoint vertically and then narrows again until reaching the top.
  • The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The top and bottom of the container are circles of the same size.
  • Moving from bottom to top, the width of the container narrows to reach its thinnest point and then increases up until the vertical midpoint.
  • At this point it has a width greater than the width of the circular base.
  • The width then narrows again and widens until reaching the top.
  • The top and bottom halves of the container are symmetric.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
